Reason: The QUALITY configuration option in the batik software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact the rendering quality of images produced by the software. Higher quality settings may require more computational resources and memory, leading to longer execution times and increased memory consumption. On the other hand, lower quality settings may result in faster performance but at the cost of reduced image quality. Therefore, the QUALITY configuration option has a noticeable effect on system performance and is considered performance-sensitive.
